oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-05-21 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 21, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hawkshaw Hawkins (host/performer), guest performer Patsy Cline (although Jean Shepard was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Stringbean. The Michigan Week queens of Kay Seidelman (Honey Queen), Melissa Beth Tornberg (Cherry Queen), Carol Kay Peterson (Apple Queen), and Carolyn Peyerk (Bean Queen), also appear as guests. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1076th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Archie Campbell; Ferlin Husky; Patsy Cline; Stringbean; Hawkshaw Hawkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Ferlin Husky) (recording) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Patsy Cline -- Loose Talk (Patsy Cline) -- Grant Turner introduces Michigan Week agricultural queens -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Stringbean -- Stringbean's Banjo (Stringbean) -- Grant Turner introduces Hawkshaw Hawkins -- Alaska Lil And Texas Bill (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States.
